thread.title: Lady Gaga announces Manchester show on 2017 Joanne World Tour
thread.title_full: Lady Gaga announces Manchester show on 2017 Joanne World Tour

author: Emily Heward
title: Lady Gaga announces Manchester show on 2017 Joanne World Tour
text:
Lady Gaga announces Manchester show on 2017 Joanne World Tour The Super Bowl 2017 performer is coming to Manchester Arena this October Share Lady Gaga performs at the Super Bowl (Photo: Getty Images North America) Share Get What's On   
After wowing the world with her spectacular Super Bowl half time performance, Lady Gaga has announced a new tour heading to Manchester. 
The Grammy and Golden Globe-winning singer will play one of only three UK dates at Manchester Arena on October 17 this year as part of her Joanne World Tour. 
The star gave her Little Monsters a glimpse at the show-stopping performance they can look forward to at last night's Super Bowl, where she leapt from the roof of Houston's NRG Stadium before launching into an acrobatic medley of hits including Born This Way, Bad Romance and Million Reasons - a standout from her stripped-back sixth album Joanne, released last October. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
The eccentric singer will kick off her world tour in Vancouver in August before heading to Europe, where she will also play in London and Birmingham in the UK, and then back to North America. 
Gaga - real name Stefani Joanne Angelina Germanotta - has sold more than 30 million albums worldwide since exploding into the spotlight with debut album The Fame in 2008, as well as 150 million singles sales, making her one of the best-selling musicians of all time. 
Tickets for the UK leg of the Joanne World Tour go on sale on Friday February 10 at 9am from Ticketmaster . Read More
